column4: i want to change my default dvd player to dragon player. in the sudo gedit /etc/gnome/defaults.list do i type dragon player or dragon-player in the dvd part?
i want to change my default dvd player to dragon player. in the sudo gedit /etc/gnome/defaults.list do i type dragon player or dragon-player in the dvd part?
I suppose whatever the executable name is. You could also do it graphically if you wanted: File Browser->Edit->Preferences->Removable Media
Just open your home directory or filesystem from the Places menu. That is the file browser (nautilus)
There should be an Edit menu at the top.
the only one i see is open movie player
You don't see File, Edit, and so on?
It's possible, but since no one's responding, I don't think any of us know for certain.
You need to know your processor in order to know whether it's 32 or 64-bit. Most of the P4's are 32-bit, I believe.
In fact, I can't think of a P4 that is 64-bit.
danbh_intrepid is right. The only time 64-bit is necessary (right now) is if you have 4 gigs of RAM or greater.
Evolution is kind of like Ubuntu's equivalent of OE, because it's so tightly integrated to the OS.
but doesn't that kind of lessen the value of linux when it comes to choice?
Not really, there are always alternative to choose ;)
Installing from Sun's bin is kind of messy. They really don't give you thorough enough instructions for setting the appropriate environment variables, so we just recommend people stick to the repos.
